page.title: 04COPPLESTONE CHAPEL
page.content: Copplestone chapel was built in 1831. On the end of the chapel there was a kind of house built. It was used for the preachers before they went to preach. Then another chapel was built opposite the old one. It was built in 1888 and it was made out of Bewsley stone. The old chapel was then used as a Sunday school until it got in need of repairs and also the Sunday school children were getting too big for the space. Then a new Sunday school was built onto the chapel. When the new Sunday school was built the vestry had to be knocked down. There used to be a bell tower over the old vestry. A clock in the tower has now been sold. In 1958 a pipe organ was bought and it replaced the harmonium organ which is now in the Sunday school room. There are about 40 children and 6 teachers in the School.
